snippet: The outcomes of special elections on Tuesday appeared to boil down to party-line votes, reflecting less the voters’ professed disgust with Albany than their party affiliations.
abstract: Republican Fred Akshar wins special election to replace Republican Thomas W Libous in New York State Senate and Democrat Roxanne Persaud wins special election to replace Democrat Jeffreey Ferretti; both Ferretti and Libous were convicted of corruption charges, but results show that voters preferred to vote party line rather than express disgust at culture in Albany.
lead_paragraph: The outcomes of special elections on Tuesday appeared to boil down to party-line votes, reflecting less the voters’ professed disgust with Albany than their party affiliations.

headline.main: Special Races Do Not Alter Party Tallies in New York Legislature
headline.print_headline: Special Races Do Not Alter Party Tallies in Albany
